list_definition.definition: to speak or say very softly

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: You’ll have to whisper or he’ll hear you

list_definition.definition: (of trees etc) to make a soft sound in the wind

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The leaves whispered in the breeze.

list_definition.definition: a very quiet sound, especially something said

list_ex_of_english: Now and then we hear whispers that that programme is at risk.
I can almost hear him whispering that to himself.
I hear sometimes whispers, hardly more than whispers, of possible terms of peace.
Almost as soon as the report was published there began to be whispers that it was full of mistakes, that it revealed a basic ignorance of the industry.
There is another little suggestion in those whispering corridors of broadcasting.
Will not the whispering gallery be in existence then as now?
We hear whispers, but, apart from that, there is one material fact.
He may be right, because whispering seems to include the full range of phonemes.
